description: Given an array of single digits and an integer k, return the k largest even numbers (as arrays of digits) that can be formed using the digits, each digit used at most as many times as it appears.

testCases.explanation: Largest even number from digits [1,2,3]: arrange as 312 (even, ends in 2). Represented as digit array [3,1,2].
Largest even number from [4,5,6]: 654 (ends in 4). Digit array [6,5,4].
Only digit is 0; largest even number is 0.
Largest even number from [2,1]: 12 (ends in 2). Digit array [1,2].
No even digits available; cannot form any even number. Return empty.
